memberdef.argsstring: (std::vector< Cell > *cells, const int sizex=200, const int sizey=200)
memberdef.name: CellularPotts

briefdescription.para: Constructs a CA field. This should be done in "Dish".
Plots the dish to the screen or to a movie and searches the neighbours.

detaileddescription.para: These distinct tasks have been lumped together in the same method because both for drawing the black lines between the cells and for searching the neighbours the cell borders have to be determined.

briefdescription.para: Plot the dish to Graphics window g.
Special plotting for Ising model.

detaileddescription.para: Plot in black & white for the Ising model

briefdescription.para: Searches the cells' neighbors without plotting.
Return the total area occupied by the cells.

detaileddescription.para: Plot the cells according to their cell identity, not their type. The black lines are omitted.
A simple method to plot all sigma's in window without the black lines

briefdescription.para: Divide all cells.

detaileddescription.para:
Divide all cells marked "true" in which_cells.
which_cells
is a vector<bool> with the same number of elements as the number of cells. It is a mask indicating which cells should be divided; each cell marked true will be divided.
If which_cells is empty, this method divides all cells.

briefdescription.para: Monte Carlo Step. Returns summed energy change.

detaileddescription.para:
Implements the core CPM algorithm. Carries out one MCS.
Total energy change during MCS.

briefdescription.para: Monte Carlo Step. Returns summed energy change.

detaileddescription.para:
Implements the core CPM algorithm with Kawasaki dynamics. Carries out one MCS.
Total energy change during MCS.

briefdescription.para: Monte Carlo Step. Returns summed energy change.

detaileddescription.para:
Implements Metropolis dynamics for the Ising model. Carries out one MCS.
Total energy change during MCS.

briefdescription.para: Monte Carlo Step. Returns summed energy change.

detaileddescription.para:
Implements standard large q-Potts model. Carries out one MCS.
Total energy change during MCS.

briefdescription.para: Monte Carlo Step. Returns summed energy change.

detaileddescription.para:
Implements standard large q-Potts model via Neighbor copies. Carries out one MCS.
Total energy change during MCS.

briefdescription.para: Read initial cell shape from XPM file. Reads the initial cell shape from an include xpm picture called "ZYGXPM(ZYGOTE)", and it allocates enough cells for it to the Dish.
Returns the number of completed Monte Carlo steps.
Return the horizontal size of the CA plane.
Return the vertical size of the CA plane.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int x, const int y) const
memberdef.name: Sigma

briefdescription.para: Return the value of lattice site (x,y).

detaileddescription.para: i.e. This will return the index of the cell which occupies site (x,y).

In this method the principal axes of the cells are computed using the method described in "Biometry", box 15.5
a pointer to a "new[]"ed array containing the directions. The memory has to be freed afterwards using the delete[] operator

briefdescription.para: Initialize the CA plane with n circular cells fitting in a cellsize^2 square.

detaileddescription.para:
! Fill the plane with initial cells
actual amount of cells (some are not draw due to overlap)

memberdef.argsstring: (int n_cells, int cellsize, double subfield=1., int posx=-1, int posy=-1)

briefdescription.para: Initialize the CA plane with n cells using an Eden growth algorithm.

parameterdescription.para: Defines a centered frame of size (size/subfield)^2 in which all cell will be positioned.

memberdef.argsstring: (int n_cells, int cell_size, int sx, int sy, int offset_x, int offset_y)
memberdef.name: GrowInCells

memberdef.name: SquareCell

detaileddescription.para: Draw a square cell in at (cx,cy)

briefdescription.para: Adds a new Cell and returns a reference to it.
Display the division planes returned by FindCellDirections.

parameterdescription.para: cell axes as returned by FindCellDirections.

briefdescription.para: Returns the mean area of the cells.
Returns the cell density.

detaileddescription.para: Cell density is defined as the area occupied by cells divided by the size of the field.

briefdescription.para: Set target lengths of all cells to the value given in parameter file.
Give each cell a random cell type. The number of cell types is defined by the J parameter file. (See Jtable in parameter file).

detaileddescription.para: Cells grow until twice their original target_length, then divide, with rate "growth_rate"

Draw convex hull around all cells.
The area of the convex hull in lattice sites.

Calculate compactness (summed_area/hull_area) of all cells. This is a good measure for the density.
Compactness.
